item.title: Louisiana DMV Data Can Be Bought For 21 Million Bitcoin
item.description:
Louisiana DMV Data Can Be Bought For 21 Million Bitcoin

With the weekend almost upon us, it was only a matter of time until a new data breach would make headlines. In this case. The Louisiana DMV has been breached, and the data is being sold on the deep web. Sources indicate over 250,000 driver's license records are up for grabs at the time of writing.

item.title: Hundreds of Millions of Dollars' Worth of Bitcoin Stuck for Days
item.description:
Hundreds of Millions of Dollars' Worth of Bitcoin Stuck for Days

As Bitcoin sees a stratospheric rise over the last few days, increasing by $100 in just a day, users have noted a corresponding increase in transaction confirmation delays. More than 250,000 bitcoins were waiting to move at one point yesterday, according to tradeblock, currently valued at almost $200 million.

item.title: Bitcoin Advocates Weigh in on North Carolina Regulatory Bill
item.description:
Bitcoin Advocates Weigh in on North Carolina Regulatory Bill

Virtual currency advocates provided input to a North Carolina legislative committee Tuesday on a proposed rule to improve regulation of digital currency and blockchain related businesses. The Chamber of Digital Commerce, a trade association that promotes digital assets and blockchain technology, joined representatives of IBM and the Perkins Coie law firm in meeting with the North Carolina Senate Finance Committee.

item.title: Ethereum Price Technical Analysis - All Targets Hit, Play Safe - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Ethereum Price Technical Analysis - All Targets Hit, Play Safe - NEWSBTC

Ethereum price finally broke $20.0, which is a sign that the ETH bulls are in control. Can it continue to trade higher or should we trade safe? Ethereum price finally broke $20.0, which is a sign that the ETH bulls are in control. Can it continue to trade higher or should we trade safe?

item.title: Ether Prices Pass $20 in Network First - CoinDesk
item.description:
Ether Prices Pass $20 in Network First - CoinDesk

The price of ether, the native digital asset powering the ethereum blockchain, surpassed $20 for the first time ever yesterday, reaching a key milestone and continuing a rally is has enjoyed so far this week. Ether hit $20 at 18:30 UTC, before pushing higher to reach a high of $21.10 at 19:15 UTC, data from the market's leading exchange, Poloniex, reveals.

item.title: How could a country issue it's currency on the blockchain? How would it work?
item.description:
How could a country issue it's currency on the blockchain? How would it work?

With majorities in the House and Senate, the majority of governorships, control in majority of state legislatures, as well as a conservative-leaning Supreme Court, it appears that the GOP may not be quite persuaded that they are on the wrong track.

item.title: Why is the ledger public?
item.description:
Why is the ledger public?

The ledger has to be public in order for Bitcoin to be decentralized. The designers of Bitcoin didn't want to need anyone to play the role of a "bank" who keeps all the records, and whom everyone else has to trust to do that properly.

item.title: How much testing is done on each pull request before it is merged?
item.description:
How much testing is done on each pull request before it is merged?

Frequently after one pull request is merged, multiple other pull requests follow to clean up a problem created by the first PR Recent example: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7957

item.title: Ver, Voorhees & Fenton Join John McAfee's Security Board
item.description:
Ver, Voorhees & Fenton Join John McAfee's Security Board

More investment capital could flow to companies working on ways for Bitcoin users to secure their money, with John McAfee's appointment of Roger Ver, Erik Voorhees and Bruce Fenton to key positions in his new cybersecurity-focused company.

item.title: What's Driving the Bitcoin Rally?
item.description:
What's Driving the Bitcoin Rally?

Sonny Singh, chief commercial officer at BitPay, discusses the four reasons for the surge in bitcoin. He speaks to Bloomberg's Cory Johnson on "Bloomberg West." (Source: Bloomberg)
